content.question: Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="g of x equals, x to the fourth power, minus 2 times x cubed, minus 3 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What are all values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="g prime of x, equals one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 2.6: Derivative Rules - Constant, Sum, Difference, and Constant Multiple

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
